sources.title: "The Paymaster" (1906)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "The Paymaster" is a short drama.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  A payroll clerk is framed by a man competing with him for the attentions of a mill girl. Directed by                       unknown Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             Gene Gauntier, Gordon Burbe, Jim Slevin Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                       June 28, 1906 Country                             United States Running time                    8 m.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: A superintendent forces his attentions on a mill girl. He steals the payroll and frames her boyfriend, the paymaster. A dog finds the hidden money and the mill girl confronts the superintendent with his deeds.
metadata.Actors: Gene Gauntier, Gordon Burbe, Jim Slevin
